title: Science Easy Quiz
description: Test your science knowledge with easy level questions

questions.text: What is the largest animal currently on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Whale

questions.text: Stars consist mainly of hydrogen and which other gas?
Who discovered the Law of Gravity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Isaac Newton

questions.text: How many chromosomes are in your body cells?
The Earth and the Moon roughly have the same mass.
What is the hottest planet in the Solar System?
An Astronomical Unit is the distance between Earth and the Moon.
What is the common name of the chemical compound "dihydrogen monoxide"?
Which noble gas has the lowest atomic number?
Salt is 100% composed of Sodium.
What is the largest planet in the Solar System?
Human cells typically have how many copies of each gene?
How many bones are in the human body?
What does DNA stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deoxyribonucleic Acid

questions.text: About what percentage of the Earth's surface is water?
The biggest distinction between a eukaryotic cell and a prokaryotic cell is:

options.text: The presence or absence of a nucleus
The presence or absence of certain organelles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The presence or absence of a nucleus

questions.text: A plant that has a life cycle for more than a year is known as an annual.

title: Science Medium Quiz
description: Test your science knowledge with medium level questions

questions.text: What is the Linnean name of the domestic apple tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malus pumila

questions.text: Sugar contains fat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernest Rutherford

questions.text: Centripetal force is an apparent force that acts outward on a body moving around a center, arising from the body's inertia.

Shrimp can swim backwards.
Steel is an alloy of Iron and Carbon.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UY Scuti

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a part of the structure of a typical neuron?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Islets of Langerhans

questions.text: The Doppler effect applies to light.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 27° Million F (15° Million C)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great white shark

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B

title: Math Easy Quiz
description: Test your math knowledge with easy level questions

questions.text: An equilateral triangle always has every angle measuring 60°.

In Roman Numerals, what does XL equate to?
What is the correct order of operations for solving equations?

options.text: Addition, Multiplication, Division, Subtraction, Addition, Parentheses
The order in which the operations are written.
Parentheses, Exponents, Addition, Substraction, Multiplication, Division
Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction

questions.text: The 'Squaring the Circle' problem is solvable.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Quintillionth

title: Math Hard Quiz

questions.text: What is the smallest number that can be expressed as the sum of two positive cubes in two different ways?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Folium of Descartes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galois Theory

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bertrand Russel

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Von Neumann
